snippet: Of the 1,925 cases detected in 2011, almost 70 percent were in people who had visited Africa.
abstract: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention says malaria cases in United States have reached 40-year high, but virtually all cases were in travelers who were infected overseas; says of the 1,925 cases detected in 2011, almost 70 percent were in people who had visited Africa.
lead_paragraph: Of the 1,925 cases detected in 2011, almost 70 percent were in people who had visited Africa.

headline.main: Malaria in United States Is at a 40-Year High
headline.print_headline: Malaria In United States Is at a 40-Year High

keywords.value: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
keywords.name: organizations
